IM.Alg2.2.8.description: End Behavior (Part 1): Let’s investigate the shape of polynomials.

IM.Alg2.2.10.description: Multiplicity: Let’s sketch some polynomial functions.

IM.Alg2.2.11.description: Finding Intersections: Let’s think about two polynomials at once.

IM.Alg2.2.14.description: What Do You Know About Polynomials?

IM.Alg2.2.16.description: Minimizing Surface Area: Let’s investigate surface areas of different cylinders.

IM.Alg2.2.18.description: Graphs of Rational Functions (Part 2): Let’s learn about horizontal asymptotes.

IM.Alg2.2.25.description: Summing Up: Let’s figure out a better way to add numbers.

IM.Alg2.3.1.description: Properties of Exponents: Let’s use integer exponents.

IM.Alg2.3.7.description: Inequivalent Equations: Let’s see what happens when we square each side of an equation.

IM.Alg2.3.15.description: Working Backwards: Let's use what we've learned about multiplying complex numbers.

IM.Alg2.4.1.description: Growing and Shrinking: Let’s calculate exponential change.

IM.Alg2.5.1.description: Matching up to Data: Let’s describe how to transform graphs.

IM.Alg2.5.2.description: Moving Functions: Let’s represent vertical and horizontal translations using function notation.

IM.Alg2.5.3.description: More Movement: Let’s translate graphs vertically and horizontally to match situations.

IM.Alg2.5.6.description: Symmetry in Equations: Let’s use equations to decide if a function is even, odd, or neither.

IM.Alg2.5.11.description: Making a Model for Data: Let’s model with functions.

IM.Alg2.6.16.description: Features of Trigonometric Graphs (Part 2): Let's explore a trigonometric function modeling a situation.

IM.Alg2.6.19.description: Beyond Circles: Let's use trigonometric functions to model data.

IM.Alg2.7.1.description: Being Skeptical: Let’s examine some ways people use statistics.
